summary.para: Camera that uses perspective projection. This projection mode is designed to mimic the way the human eyes see. It is the most common projection mode used for rendering a 3D scene.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Cameras.PerspectiveCamera.Fov
member.summary: Camera frustum vertical field of view. Default value is 75;

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Cameras.PerspectiveCamera.Near
member.summary: Camera frustum near plane distance.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Cameras.PerspectiveCamera.Far
member.summary: Camera frustum far plane distance.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Cameras.PerspectiveCamera.Aspect
member.summary: Camera frustum aspect ratio. It is calculated by Blazor3D component as current width divided by current height.

member.name: T:Blazor3D.Controls.OrbitControls
member.summary: Orbit controls.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Controls.OrbitControls.Enabled
member.summary: If true, then enabled. Otherwise, disabled. Default is true.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Controls.OrbitControls.MinDistance
member.summary: Minimal distance. Default is 0.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Controls.OrbitControls.MaxDistance
member.summary: Maximal distance to zoom. Default is 10000;

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Controls.OrbitControls.TargetPosition
member.summary: The point where the camera is looking at. Default is (0,0,0).

summary.para: A representation of geometry for mesh, line, or point. Includes vertex positions, face indices, normals, colors, UVs, and custom attributes within buffers, reducing the cost of passing all this data to the GPU.

member.summary: Optional name of the object. Default is an empty string. It has not to be unique.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Core.BufferGeometry.Uuid
member.summary: Universal unique identifier of this object instance. It's automatically assigned Guid, so it shouldn't be edited.

summary.para: Class for rectangular cuboid with a given 'width', 'height', and 'depth'.

member.summary: The length of the edges parallel to the X axis. Default is 1.

member.summary: The length of the edges parallel to the Y axis. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.BoxGeometry.Depth
member.summary: The length of the edges parallel to the Z axis. Default is 1.

member.summary: Number of segmented rectangular faces along the width of the sides. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.BoxGeometry.HeightSegments
member.summary: Number of segmented rectangular faces along the height of the sides. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.BoxGeometry.DepthSegments

summary.para: Class for a capsule with given radus and height. It is constructed using a lathe.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CapsuleGeometry.Radius
member.summary: Radius of the capsule. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CapsuleGeometry.Length
member.summary: Length of the middle section. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CapsuleGeometry.CapSegments
member.summary: Number of curve segments used to build the caps. Defaults to 4.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CapsuleGeometry.RadialSegments
member.summary: Number of segmented faces around the circumference of the capsule. Defaults to 8.

summary.para: Class for a simple shape of Euclidean geometry. It is constructed from a number of triangular segments that are oriented around a central point and extend as far out as a given radius. It is built counter-clockwise from a start angle and a given central angle. It can also be used to create regular polygons, where the number of segments determines the number of sides.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CircleGeometry.Radius
member.summary: Radius of the circle. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CircleGeometry.Segments
member.summary: Number of segments (triangles). Minimum = 3, default = 8.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CircleGeometry.ThetaStart
member.summary: Start angle for first segment. Default is 0 (three o'clock position).

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.CircleGeometry.ThetaLength
member.summary: The central angle, often called theta, of the circular sector. The default is 2*Pi, which makes for a complete circle.

member.name: T:Blazor3D.Geometires.ConeGeometry
member.summary:
A class for generating cone geometries.
Wrapper for three.js ConeGeometry

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.ConeGeometry.Radius
member.summary: Radius of the cone base. Defaults to 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.ConeGeometry.Height
member.summary: Height of the cone. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.ConeGeometry.RadialSegments
member.summary: Number of segmented faces around the circumference of the cone. Default is 8.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.ConeGeometry.HeightSegments
member.summary: Number of rows of faces along the height of the cone. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.ConeGeometry.OpenEnded
member.summary: A Boolean indicating whether the base of the cone is open or capped. Default is false, meaning capped.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.ConeGeometry.ThetaStart
member.summary: Start angle for first segment. Default is 0 (three o'clock position).

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.ConeGeometry.ThetaLength
member.summary: The central angle, often called theta, of the circular sector. The default is 2*Pi, which makes for a complete circle.

summary.para: A class for generating cylinder geometries.

member.summary: The central angle, often called theta, of the circular sector. The default is 2*Pi, which makes for a complete circle.

summary.para: A class for generating a dodecahedron geometries.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.DodecahedronGeometry.Radius
member.summary: Radius of the dodecahedron. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.DodecahedronGeometry.Detail
member.summary: Default is 0. Setting this to a value greater than 0 adds vertices making it no longer a dodecahedron.

summary.para: A class for generating an icosahedron geometry.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.IcosahedronGeometry.Radius
member.summary: Radius of the icosahedron. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.IcosahedronGeometry.Detail
member.summary: Default is 0. Setting this to a value greater than 0 adds more vertices making it no longer an icosahedron. When detail is greater than 1, it's closer to a sphere.

summary.para: A class for generating an octahedron geometry.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.OctahedronGeometry.Radius
member.summary: Radius of the octahedron. Default is 1.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.OctahedronGeometry.Detail
member.summary: Default is 0. Setting this to a value greater than 0 adds more vertices making it no longer an octahedron.

member.summary: Outer radius of the ring. Default is 1.

member.summary: Number of segments. A higher number means the ring will be more round. Minimum is 3. Default is 8.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.RingGeometry.PhiSegments
member.summary: Number of rows of faces from inner to outer radii. Minimum is 1. Default is 1.

member.summary: Start angle for first segment. Default is 0 (three o'clock position).

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Geometires.RingGeometry.ThetaLength
member.summary: The central angle, often called theta, of the circular sector. The default is 2*Pi, which makes for a complete circle.

summary.para: This light globally illuminates all objects in the scene equally. This light cannot be used to cast shadows as it does not have a direction.
Light color. You can use web color values to set up required color. Default value is "white"
Value of the light's strength/intensity. Default is 1.
A light that gets emitted from a single point in all directions. A common use case for this is to replicate the light emitted from a bare lightbulb.
When distance value is NOT 0, light will attenuate linearly from maximum intensity at the light's position down to zero at this distance from the light.
When distance is zero, light does not attenuate.
The amount the light dims along the distance of the light
Materials describe the appearance of objects. They are defined in a mostly renderer-independent way, so you don't have to rewrite materials if you decide to use a different renderer.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Materials.Material.Name
member.summary: Optional name of the object. Default is an empty string. It has not to be unique.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Materials.Material.Uuid
member.summary: Universal unique identifier of this object instance. It's automatically assigned Guid, so it shouldn't be edited.

summary.para: A standard physically based Material, using Metallic-Roughness workflow.
Light color. You can use web color values to set up required color. Default value is "orange"

Representing Euler Angles. Euler angles describe a rotational transformation by rotating an object on its various axes in specified amounts per axis, and a specified axis order. Iterating through a Euler instance will yield its components (x, y, z, order) in the corresponding order.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Maths.Euler.X
member.summary: The float angle of the X axis in radians. Default is 0. Optional.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Maths.Euler.Y
member.summary: The float angle of the Y axis in radians. Default is 0. Optional.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Maths.Euler.Z
member.summary: The float angle of the Z axis in radians. Default is 0. Optional.

member.name: P:Blazor3D.Maths.Euler.Order
member.summary: String representing the order that the rotations are applied. Default is 'XYZ'. Must be upper case.

summary.para: Class representing a 3D vector. A 3D vector is an ordered triplet of numbers (labeled x, y, and z), which can be used to represent a number of things, such as:

Scenes allow you to set up what and where is to be rendered by Blazor3D. This is the place where you put your 3D objects and lights.
